sen.j: 豊臣秀長および、養子豊臣秀保に仕えたが、文禄3年（1594年）4月、秀保がにわかに没したのちに豊臣秀吉の直参となり、大和国内（播磨国内という説もあり）にて17000石を領する。
sen.e: He served either Hidenaga TOYOTOMI or his adopted son Hideyasu TOYOTOMI however, in Apr 1594 Hideyasu unexpectedly passed away and he became a direct retainer of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI whereupon he received a 17,000 koku estate in Yamato Province (also thought by some to have been in Harima Province).

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）、関ヶ原の戦いでは西軍に与し、大坂天王寺口を守備、大和高取城の戦い、大津城の戦いにも参加した為に改易となり、その後の消息は不明。
sen.e: In the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600 he fought for the Western forces in the defense of the Tenno-ji temple entrance of Osaka Castle and also participated in the battles for Takatori Castle in Yamato Province and Otsu Castle which resulted in demotion and his subsequent whereabouts is unknown.
